meanings.definition: A type of celestial being in Christian angelology.
meanings.sent1: The seraphim watched over the earth from the heavens.
meanings.sent2: In the Bible, the seraphim are described as having six wings.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child claimed to have a pet seraphim that granted wishes.
meanings.sent4: Her voice was like a choir of seraphim, filling the room with heavenly music.
meanings.sent5: The artist painted a beautiful mural depicting the seraphim in all their glory.

meanings.definition: A member of the highest order of angels in Jewish angelology.
meanings.sent1: The seraphim were believed to be closest to God in Jewish tradition.
meanings.sent2: During the festival, the rabbi spoke of the seraphim and their divine purpose.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked that even the seraphim would struggle to understand human behavior.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness and grace made her seem like a seraphim among mortals.
meanings.sent5: The old legend spoke of a hero guided by a seraphim through the darkest of times.
